address.description: Add, remove and get list of saved addresses.

alert.description: Enable/disable automatic alerts. Alert types: payout. Actions:on, off, status, send, update. Only root user can use 'send' to trigger payout alert manually.
alert.example: !alert payout on OR, !alert payout status OR, !alert payout send 99999 99 OR, !alert payout update 10000 100

balance.description: Check your account balance. Supported addresses/chains: BTC, Dash, ETH, Halo and  LTC. Address keywords: 'reward-pool', 'charity', 'h-eth', 'dex-halo'. If no address supplied, the first item of user's address book will be used. To get balance of a specific item from address book just type the index number of the address.
balance.example: !balance 0x1234567890abcdef OR, !balance dex-halo OR, !balance OR, !balance 2 (for 2nd item in the address book)

cmc.description: Fetch CoinMarketCap ticker information. Alternatively, use the ticker itself as command.
cmc.example: !cmc powr, OR, !cmc power ledger, OR, !powr (shorthand for '!cmc powr')

dexbalance.description: Shows user's HaloDEX balances. USE YOUR HALO CHAIN ADDRESS FOR ALL TOKEN BALANCES WITHIN DEX.

guildcmd.description:
Add guild-specific custom commands. Supported actions: add, remove, update.
Adding a command name same as built-in commands will override it. To remove an existing command from the guild add the intended command with empty message. Example: !guildcmd add balance.
To restore deleted built-in command: !guildcmd remove balance
guildcmd.example: !guildcmd add sayhello Hello Discord OR, !guildcmd remove sayhello

halo.description: Get a digest of information about Halo including ticker info from DEX, reward pool and recent trades.

help.description: Prints list of commands and supported arguments. If argument 'command' is provided will display detailed information about the command along with examples.

mn.description: Shows masternode collateral, reward pool balances, nodes distribution, last payout and ROI based on last payout.

nodes.description: Lists masternodes owned by a specific address. If no address supplied, will use user's first address book item when available.

orders.description: Get HaloDEX orders by user address. If no address supplied, will use user's first address book item when available.
orders.example: !orders halo eth 10 0x1234 OR, !orders OR, !orders vet eth

trades.example: !trades halo eth 10 OR, !trades eth halo OR, !trades

tokens.description: Lists all tokens supported on HaloDEX
